p: The geographical distribution of sand flies during the last decades has shifted northward from latitudes below 45°N in southern Europe [ 17] to latitudes just above 50°N [ 18]. Recent studies show that some phlebotomine sand flies were recorded in several parts of Germany and Belgium [ 18, 19]. In central Europe, some autochthone leishmaniasis cases are being recorded in a region traditionally regarded as leishmaniasis-free [ 20, 21].
